channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Fatality Vehicle Fire; INC#1656; 09:05PM; 11800 W Strathern St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ROkm0V; #SunValley; Firefighters arrived quickly to the scene to discover an RV with heavy fire showing. During fire extinguishment, a lifeless body was discovered in the vehicle. Beyond medical help, the victim was determined deceased and remains at the scene. One adult female fled the burning RV and is in the care of Firefighter/Paramedics being treated for burns and smoke inhalation. The cause of the fire is under active investigation. Media Inquiries: LAPD Inc #4068 and Medical Examiner.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; E289 E89 RA102 RA89 T89; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1591; 08:34PM; 5025 S 7th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LJq14m; #HydePark; Firefighters arrived to find a single-story home with a roof fire that appeared to be electrical in nature and extinguished the flames in 16 minutes. No reported injuries.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E294 E46 E66 E94 RA66 RA866 SQ21 T66 T94; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1591; 08:18PM; 5025 S 7th Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LJq14m; #HydePark; One-story home with fire in the attic. Offensive mode.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 E266 E294 E46 E66 E94 RA66 RA866 SQ21 T66 T94; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

CONTAINED Brush Fire; INC#0862; 02:41PM; 1448 W Academy Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3PChDot; #EchoPark; It took 34 firefighters 73 minutes to surround the approximately quarter-acre of burned brush and extinguish the flames. No reported injuries, and no structures threatened. Crews will remain on scene to improve perimeter containment lines and extinguish hot spots within the burn footprint. Cause under investigation. Nothing further.; FS 20; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; AO1 AO2 BC1 BC2 BC5 E1 E13 E20 E203 E211 E220 E3 E35 E4 E56 E6 E90 EA1 EA2 EM1 EM11 H3 H4 H7 HA3 HA4 HA7 RA3 T11 T20 T3; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Brush Fire; INC#0862; 01:28PM; 1448 W Academy Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3PChDot; #EchoPark; Quarter-acre of light/medium brush burning. Firefighters are responding by ground and air.; FS 20; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 13; AO1 AO2 BC1 BC2 BC5 E20 E203 E211 E220 E3 E35 E56 E6 E90 EM1 EM11 H3 H4 H7 HA3 HA4 HA7 T11 T20 T3; CH5; 13; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 10/02/2023 INC#0118

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0118; 03:21AM; 3719 S Western Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3REsMrl; #ExpositionPark; 97 LAFD Firefighters took just 25 minutes of well-coordinated offensive firefighting operations to access, confine and fully extinguish flames in two adjacent one-story buildings, including a commercial building of fire origin at 3719 S. Western Avenue that had flames through the roof on firefighter's arrival, with fire extension limited to the attic only, of an adjacent church at 3717 S Western Avenue. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 34; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC18 CM20 CM22 E15 E203 E226 E233 E26 E266 E29 E294 E3 E34 E66 E94 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA3 RA34 RA834 SO1 SQ21 T15 T26 T3 T33 T66 T94 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0118; 02:56AM; 3719 S Western Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3REsMrl; #ExpositionPark; PRELIM: Offensive firefighting operations on one commercial building at 3719 S. Western Ave, that had fire through the roof on LAFD arrival, with flames extending to the attic of an adjacent church at 3717 S Western Ave.; FS 34; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC18 CM20 CM22 E15 E203 E226 E233 E26 E266 E29 E294 E3 E34 E66 E94 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA34 RA834 SO1 SQ21 T15 T26 T3 T33 T66 T94 UR3 UR88 ; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Hiker Rescue; INC#1186; 05:44PM; West Mandeville Fire Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3PCKx7S; #Brentwood; LAFD has responded by ground and air to assist a 55 year-old male hiker who became suddenly ill on a remote section of the West Mandeville Fire Road in Westridge-Canyonback Wilderness Regional Park. An LAFD rescue helicopter was first to find the seriously ill man, and lowered a Flight Paramedic to medically assess, and begin his immediate treatment. The patient and rescuer will soon be hoisted aboard the hovering helicopter for in-flight advanced care during direct transport to a regional hospital. ; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC9 BP19 E19 E269 H1 H3 HA1 HA3 RA19 RH114 T69; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

Cliff Rescue; INC#1632; 11:40PM; 3740 S Meyler St; MAP: https://bit.ly/46x8AvP; #SanPedro; LAFD divers were able to access the interior of the heavily damaged coupe wedged upside down between rocks in the high surf, to discover and extricate one lifeless adult male occupant. Beyond medical help, he was determined dead and remains secure near the wreckage pending the Medical Examiner's arrival. A thorough search within the heavily damaged vehicle, as well as a spotlight and helicopter infrared search of the shoreline yielded no other victims. LAFD crews will assist Medical Examiner's staff in the safe, discreet and dignified recovery of the decedent from the shoreline as soon as the investigation and conditions allow. Media Inquiries: LAPD South Traffic / LAPD Harbor Division (Incident #3881) and Medical Examiner.; FS 101; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 BT1 BT2 BT5 E101 E112 E248 E285 E48 E85 EM13 H1 H2 HA1 HA2 RA101 RA85 RH114 T48 T85 UR85 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

Update Cliff Rescue; INC#1632; 11:05PM; 3740 S Meyler St; MAP: https://bit.ly/46x8AvP; #SanPedro; LAFD divers from the trio of assigned LAFD fireboats have found the heavily damaged vehicle upside down in the pounding surf, wedged between large rocks on the rugged shoreline at maximum tide. One of the two LAFD rescue helicopters is utilizing a 30 million candlepower searchlights (along with those of the fireboats) to illuminate the challenging rescue scene for the LAFD divers, who have yet to find a victim, as they relentlessly seek to gain access to the upside down vehicle, which has a collapsed roof with significant passenger space intrusion.; FS 101; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 BT1 BT2 BT5 E101 E112 E248 E285 E48 E85 EM13 H1 H2 HA1 HA2 RA101 RA85 RH114 T48 T85 UR85 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Brian Humphrey
